intro: Hedyotis nagporensis, commonly known as the Nagpore buttonweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including India and Nepal. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or yellow flowers and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Hedyotis nagporensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
